name: manage-engine-service-desk-plus-msp
label: ManageEngine ServiceDesk Plus MSP
description: ServiceDesk Plus MSP is a web based, full-fledged ITSM suite designed specifically for managed service providers. This all-in-one ITSM solution delivers comprehensive help desk, service desk, account management, asset management, remote controls and advanced reporting in a multi-tenant architecture with robust data segregation. It empowers service providers to offer services and support to multiple clients with centralized controls.This connector provides automated actions to create, update, delete and close tickets

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: Specify the URL of the ManageEngine ServiceDesk Plus MSP server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: API Key
fields.name: token
fields.description: Specify the API key that is configured for your account to access the ManageEngine ServiceDesk Plus MSP endpoint.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.

operations.title: Get All Tickets
operations.description: Retrieves details of all tickets or specific tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket Request ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Subject
parameters.name: subject
parameters.tooltip: Specify the subject of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the subject of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status.name
parameters.tooltip: Select the status of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the status of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between Assigned, Cancelled, Closed, In Progress, Onhold, Open, Resolved etc.

parameters.title: Priority
parameters.name: priority.name
parameters.tooltip: Select the priority of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Select the priority of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between High, Low, Medium, or Normal etc.

parameters.title: Requester Name
parameters.name: requester.name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the requester whose tickets details you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the requester whose tickets details you want to retrieve tickets from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.name: other_fields

parameters.title: Filter By
parameters.name: filter_by

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.tooltip: Specify the field using which you want to sort the tickets retrieved from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the field using which you want to sort the tickets retrieved from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. For example, subject

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.tooltip: Select the order in which you want to sort the tickets retrieved from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Select the order in which you want to sort the tickets retrieved from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between Ascending or Descending.

parameters.title: Start From
parameters.name: from
parameters.tooltip: Specify the index of the first item (tickets) to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records. By default, this is set as 1.
parameters.description: Specify the index of the first item (tickets) to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records. By default, this is set as 1.

parameters.title: Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records (tickets) to be returned by this operation in a single request.By default it will retrieve 10 records. Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1 and Maximum of only 100 records can retrieved at a time.
parameters.description: Specify the index till when, i.e. the last item (tickets) to be returned by this operation in a single request. By default it will retrieve 10 records. Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1 and Maximum of only 100 records can retrieved at a time.

operations.title: Create Ticket
operations.description: Creates a ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the requester, subject, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Subject
parameters.name: subject
parameters.tooltip: Specify the subject of the ticket request that you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the subject of the ticket request that you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Requester
parameters.name: requester
parameters.tooltip: Specify the requester name, in the JSON format, who is requesting the creation of the ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. For example, {"name":"Guest", "id":"3"}
parameters.description: Specify the requester name, in the JSON format, who is requesting the creation of the ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. For example, {"name":"Guest", "id":"3"}

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: Specify the description of the ticket request that you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the description of the ticket request that you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Request Type
parameters.name: request_type
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the type of ticket request that you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. 
Request type can be Incident, Request For Information, etc.
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the type of ticket request that you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. 
Request type can be Incident, Request For Information, etc.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Select the status that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the status that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between Assigned, Cancelled, Closed, In Progress, Onhold, Open, Resolved etc.

parameters.title: Priority
parameters.name: priority
parameters.tooltip: Select the priority that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the priority that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between High, Low, Medium, Normal etc.

parameters.title: Urgency
parameters.name: urgency
parameters.tooltip: Select the urgency that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the urgency that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between High, Low, Normal, Urgent etc.

parameters.title: Group
parameters.name: group
parameters.tooltip: Specify the group that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the group that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to create in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. 
Group can be Hardware Problems, Network, Printer Problems, etc

parameters.title: MSP Site Details
parameters.name: site
parameters.tooltip:
MSP site details in Service Desk Plus. eg. {"id":302 ,
"name":"India-Pune"}
parameters.description:
MSP site details in Service Desk Plus to which this request will be added to. eg. {"id":302 ,
"name":"India-Pune"}

parameters.title: MSP Account Details
parameters.name: account
parameters.tooltip:
MSP account details in Service Desk Plus. eg. {"id":"1" ,
"name":"My Org Inc"}
parameters.description:
MSP account details in Service Desk Plus to which this request will be added to. eg. {"id":"1" ,
"name":"My Org Inc"}

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.name: other_fields

operations.title: Update Ticket
operations.description: Updates an existing ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the ticket request ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket Request ID
parameters.name: request_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket that you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket that you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Subject
parameters.name: subject
parameters.tooltip: Specify the subject of the ticket request that you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the subject of the ticket request that you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: Specify the description of the ticket request that you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the description of the ticket request that you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Select the status that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the status that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between Assigned, Cancelled, Closed, In Progress, Onhold, Open, Resolved etc.

parameters.title: Urgency
parameters.name: urgency
parameters.tooltip: Select the urgency that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the urgency that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between High, Low, Normal, Urgent etc.

parameters.title: Priority
parameters.name: priority
parameters.tooltip: Select the priority that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the priority that you want to assign to the ticket request you want to update in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between High, Low, Medium, Normal etc.

parameters.title: MSP Site Details
parameters.name: site
parameters.tooltip:
MSP site details in Service Desk Plus. eg. {"id":302 ,
"name":"India-Pune"}
parameters.description:
MSP site details in Service Desk Plus to which this request will be updated to. eg. {"id":302 ,
"name":"India-Pune"}

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.name: other_fields

operations.title: Close Ticket
operations.description: Closes a ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the ticket request ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket Request ID
parameters.name: request_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: FCR
parameters.name: is_fcr
parameters.tooltip: Select this option if the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP has been marked as First Call Resolution (FCR).
parameters.description: Select this option if the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP has been marked as First Call Resolution (FCR).

parameters.title: Has Requester Acknowledged The Resolution?
parameters.name: requester_ack_resolution
parameters.tooltip: Select this option if the resolution of the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP has been acknowledged by the requester.
parameters.description: Select this option if the resolution of the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP has been acknowledged by the requester.

parameters.title: Comments
parameters.name: requester_ack_comments
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comment specified by the requester while acknowledging the resolution of the ticket.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the comment specified by the requester while acknowledging the resolution of the ticket.

parameters.title: Request Closure Code
parameters.name: closure_code
parameters.tooltip: Select the closure code that you want to assign to the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the closure code that you want to assign to the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between Cancelled, Failed, Moved, Postponed, Success, or Unable to Reproduce.

parameters.title: Request Closure Comments
parameters.name: closure_comments
parameters.tooltip: Specify the closure comment to be added to the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the closure comment to be added to the ticket that you want to close in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

operations.title: Delete Ticket
operations.description: Deletes a ticket (moves it to 'trash') from ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the ticket request ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket Request ID
parameters.name: request_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket that you want to delete (move to trash) from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket that you want to delete (move to trash) from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

operations.title: Delete Ticket From Trash
operations.description: Permanently deletes a ticket from the 'Trash' in ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the Ticket Request ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket Request ID
parameters.name: request_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket that you want to permanently delete from the 'trash' in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket that you want to permanently delete from the 'trash' in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

operations.title: Add Resolution
operations.description: Adds a resolution to an existing ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the ticket request ID and resolution you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket Request ID
parameters.name: request_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket request to which you want to add the resolution in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket request to which you want to add the resolution in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Resolution
parameters.name: resolution
parameters.tooltip: Specify the resolution that you want to add to the specified ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the resolution that you want to add to the specified ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

operations.title: Add Note
operations.description: Adds a note to an existing ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the ticket request ID, description, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket Request ID
parameters.name: request_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket request to which you want to add the note in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket request to which you want to add the note in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: Specify the note that you want to add to the specified ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the note that you want to add to the specified ticket in ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Show to Requester
parameters.name: show_to_requester
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox, i.e. set it to True, to show the note to requester. By default, this is set as False, i.e. it is set as a private note.
parameters.description: Select this checkbox, i.e. set it to True, to show the note to requester. By default, this is set as False, i.e. it is set as a private note.

parameters.title: Mark First Response
parameters.name: mark_first_response
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox, i.e. set it to True, to set the responded date of the request/ticket. By default, this is set as False.
parameters.description: Select this checkbox, i.e. set it to True, to set the responded date of the request/ticket. By default, this is set as False.

parameters.title: Add to Linked Requests
parameters.name: add_to_linked_requests
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox, i.e. set it to 'True', to add the note to the linked requests. By default, this is set as 'False'.
parameters.description: Select this checkbox, i.e. set it to 'True', to add the note to the linked requests. By default, this is set as 'False'.

parameters.title: Notify Technician
parameters.name: notify_technician
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox, i.e. set it to True, to notify the technician by email when the note is added. By default, this is set as False.
parameters.description: Select this checkbox, i.e. set it to True, to notify the technician by email when the note is added. By default, this is set as False.

operations.title: Get Ticket Details
operations.description: Retrieves details of a specific ticket from ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the ticket request ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket Request ID
parameters.name: request_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve ticket details from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket request for which you want to retrieve ticket details from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

operations.title: Get All Users
operations.description: Retrieves details of all users or specific user from ServiceDesk Plus MSP based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: User Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Employee ID
parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the employee ID of the user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the employee ID of the user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Email ID
parameters.name: email_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the email ID of the user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Specify the email ID of the user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: User Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP.
parameters.description: Select the type of user whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between User or Technician.

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.name: other_fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify custom fields, in the JSON format, that you want to use for filtering requesters whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. For example, { "name": "abc" }
parameters.description: Specify custom fields, in the JSON format, that you want to use for filtering requesters whose details you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. For example, { "name": "abc" }

parameters.title: Fields Required
parameters.name: fields_required
parameters.tooltip: Specify the fields required to be retrieved for the users you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can specify multiple fields using a comma separator.
parameters.description: Specify the fields required to be retrieved for the users you want to retrieve from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can specify multiple fields using a comma separator. For example, name,status,phone,mobile,jobtitle

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.tooltip: Specify the field using which you want to sort the users retrieved from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. For example, name
parameters.description: Specify the field using which you want to sort the users retrieved from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. For example, name

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.tooltip: Select the order in which you want to sort the users retrieved from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between Ascending or Descending.
parameters.description: Select the order in which you want to sort the users retrieved from ServiceDesk Plus MSP. You can choose between Ascending or Descending.

parameters.title: Start From
parameters.name: start_index
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the index of the first item (user) to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records. 
Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1.
parameters.description:
Specify the index of the first item (user) to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records. 
Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1.

parameters.title: Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records (users) to be returned by this operation in a single request.By default it will retrieve 10 records. Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1 and Maximum of only 100 records can retrieved at a time.
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of records (users) to be returned by this operation in a single request.By default it will retrieve 10 records. Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1 and Maximum of only 100 records can retrieved at a time.

operations.title: Get All Sites
operations.description: Retrieves information of all site details Service Desk Plus MSP.

parameters.title: Start From
parameters.name: from
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the index of the record (Site) to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records. 
Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1.
parameters.description:
Specify the index of the record (Site) to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records. 
Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1.

parameters.title: Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records (sites) to be returned by this operation in a single request.By default it will retrieve 10 records. Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1 and Maximum of only 100 records can retrieved at a time.
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of records (sites) to be returned by this operation in a single request.By default it will retrieve 10 records. Note: You can specify the minimum number as 1 and Maximum of only 100 records can retrieved at a time.

operations.title: Get All Accounts
operations.description: Retrieves information of all accounts details Service Desk Plus MSP.
